item.title: Tarmac around a manhole cover on pavement at bottom of Strickland Rd has broken up, 25th September
item.description:
The tarmac around a manhole cover on the pavement at bottom of Strickland Rd (by the road name sign) is badly broken up and there is a patch of badly broken pavement a little bit downhill from the cover (see photos)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Street light out, 25th September
item.description:
Street light out in proximity of Lypiatt cottage, Tivoli Walk. Not sure how long the light has been out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Tivoli Walk, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Island is damaged due to vehicles driving into it. Island is badly designed/located/marked. Markings - this island is the only traffic island in Grovefield Way with white lane markings aligned directly with kerbstones (see photo for comparison with preceding island) Natural flow of road leads directly into kerbstone of traffic island, see photo for cars taking up the very right hand part of traffic lane (of an observed sample of 10 cars, 9 took a similar position going past island or were closer). Super elevation of road throws cars towards centre of road., 25th September
item.description:
Traffic Island is in Grovefield Way, It is located outside Arle Court Park and Ride locked entrance/exit and in line with the B&Q building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path breaking up due to 30 years of twin axle refuse lorries on full left lock forced to drive over pavement and scuff surface with rear wheels. Parked cars force lorries to go onto pavement in order to reverse into Pyrton Mews, 25th September
item.description:
Pavement (and kerb) on corner of Pyrton Mews and Runnymede, outside of 10 Runnymede.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pyrton Mews, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Fallen tree, 25th September
item.description:
Apologies. Street view picture. The actual tree is larger and is at the front of the flats on Tewkesbury Rd, opposite Colletts Drive. Unfortunately, it has fallen so it is now partially blocking the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43-54, Tewkesbury Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sinkhole the size of an apple next to school grounds on public pavement., 25th September
item.description:
Glynrosa Road right next to the school gate entrance and next to the lamppost. The hole had grown from a golf ball to an apple within 2 hours. There is visible hollow ground under the hole. The pavement is cracking around the hole. I have put my shoe there for size comparison.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East End Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Very Dangerous Pothole!, 25th September
item.description:
Reported already but was fraudulently closed by Ringway in order to meet targets. Pothole/ dangerous road surface still a problem and has not been fixed. ---- Web Reference: 6500789 Enquiry Number: 22058487 Issue: Pothole on the Carriageway Location: Very dangerous pothole. The road needs completely resurfacing ASAP. Site: 3/190 GREEN DRAGON INN COCKLESFORD TO HI

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Shurdington, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain is completely blocked and does not drain away any surface water which has contributed to flooding to a couple of nearby lower basement apartments at Regent House., 25th September
item.description:
The drain outside number 8/10 is blocked'

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Montpellier Drive, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is NO drain to remove water where it collects, 25th September
item.description:
There are drains in this area but they are NOT located where the water pools. The water pools at the pedestrian crossing and there are NO drains at the pedestrian crossing. The drains are located on high ground. This pedestrian crossing/cycle path was only just built summer 2024. But it was not built with drains that are located in places that will drain the water. This is not an issue with a clogged drain; it is an issue with a missing drain. I received a message today that this issue was resolved - these photos were taken after I received that message. It is clearly not resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path not passable. People have to walk in the road. Access to house only with wellies. Told it had been fixed. Not true., 25th September
item.description:
Outside 82 Evesham Road Been reported previously

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains are in the wrong position, 25th September
item.description:
The drainage for the brand-new pedestrian and cycle crossing between Central Cross Drive and West Drive does not work. The crossing quickly becomes flooded when there is any rain, making it unusable for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road floods causing a problem for pedestrians, 25th September
item.description:
Wellington Road has always had a flooded area just along from the roundabout on Prestbury Road. This causes a problem for pedestrians as cars drive through the significant puddle, potentially soaking people walking on the footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New footpath doesn't meet existing footpath, 25th September
item.description:
The new crossing from Central Cross Drive to West Drive. There is a partial new footpath that ends in the middle of the grass. This is no good in wet weather as the ground is wet, boggy and covered in puddles. This means that pedestrians then have to walk in the road/cycle path to get to the crossing. The new footpath needs to be extended to meet the existing footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

Where Back Albert Place meets Prestbury Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Albert Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Button stuck so lights go red when no one is there, 25th September
item.description:
The button on the pedestrian crossing is stuck down so the lights go red constantly even when no one is wanting to cross. When the bad rain came a couple of days ago the control pads were getting soaked with flood water, maybe the problem?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46-61, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
